abstracts.cdata!:
This is a resettlement action plan for
            the Yangtze Basin Flood Control Project, which reinforces
            the main dykes of the Yangtze in Hunan, Hubei, and Jiangxi
            provinces and repairs dangerous sections of the dyke. The
            project involves considerable impacts on local populations,
            primarily through structural and land losses and economic
            adjustment associated with reduced available cultivated land
            following re-allocation of village lands. Key principles of
            resettlement compensation designed according to the national
            Chinese legal framework as well as World Bank operational
            directives aim to restore resettlers to their original
            standard of living at least. While many villages will be
            affected, in most instances this affects only a small
            portion of each-overall an average of 9 percent of the total
            population. Land acquisition impacts on production for
            enterprises will be minor with few of the affected
            establishments requiring complete relocation. Estimated
            post-resettlement land areas will be about 5 percent below
            existing levels. Agricultural households will receive
            equivalent land nearby or cash compensation to offset land
            loss. Those temporarily losing land will also be compensated
            and their land returned to them after use. Persons affected
            by loss of settlements (including housing, buildings, and
            scattered trees) will be compensated for housing, receive
            replacement land, temporary accommodations, and
            transportation/relocation allowances. Compensation for crop
            loss will be paid.
